meanings.definition: To splash or scatter liquid onto something.
meanings.sent1: The kids sploshed in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally sploshed water on the floor while doing dishes.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy sploshed water all over the bathroom during bath time.
meanings.sent4: The storm sploshed rain against the windows all night long.
meanings.sent5: The chef sploshed sauce onto the plate, creating a beautiful design.

meanings.sent1: After a few too many drinks, he felt sploshed and dizzy.
meanings.sent2: She looked sploshed as she stumbled out of the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed sploshed after knocking over a bottle of catnip.
meanings.sent4: The room spun around her, making her feel sploshed and disoriented.
meanings.sent5: His sploshed behavior at the office party was quite embarrassing.
